occurrences.text: righteousness. He's concerned about holy living. And we find at the start of the church, when the church is just in its infancy, if we could use that terminology this morning, we find that what God is doing is he's helping for the church to understand the importance of holiness. See, we don't want the church to be corrupted by sin. And so God deals with it very severely. We find that not only does he deal with it severely, but then he tells us in 1 Corinthians chapter number 11, when we think about the church in Corinth and here in this portion of Scripture. In fact, I'll be preaching from 1 Corinthians 11 this evening as we observe the Lord's Supper. But we find in 1 Corinthians 11, at the end of the passage of Scripture dealing specifically with the Lord's Supper, the Bible says in verse number 30, for this cause, the fact that people were drinking and eating unworthily the Lord's Supper, for this cause many are weak and sickly among you and many sleep. That word sleep, as we know, it means to die, all right? Remember with Lazarus, when he was sick and Jesus said to the disciples, he's asleep. And they said, well, listen, if he's asleep, then let him sleep. And he spoke plainly and said, he's dead. He's dead. And here, the text of Scripture, this word sleep means to die.
